tags: sometimes you need to allow yourself to be petty and meme things in life
Anon kind of won because I overcooked my pasta while answering this post lolololololololololol
summary: man fuck off with 'catelyn deserved redemption' as if she did anything wrong. jon is not her son, step son or part of her...
question: man fuck off with 'catelyn deserved redemption' as if she did anything wrong. jon is not her son, step son or part of her family. she simply ignored (except for that *one* incident when bran fell). can't stand you jon fangirls. get the fuck out of her tag
answer:
oof. 

I can’t choose which reaction pic I want to use so I’ll try out both and you guys comment which meme you like better:

1)

2)

My week has been simply too good for anons to ruin it lol. I got free front row tickets to Ramin Djawadi concert and 105 out of 100 on statistics exam, nothing can defeat me muahahaha!

I’ll take the time to answer this anyway.

Neither Catlyn, nor Jon, nor Daenerys, nor Sansa, nor Tyrion, Theon, Melisandre or Robb are perfect characters, George R.R Martin makes sure to let us know from day one. 

While I adore Catelyn Stark and her storyline, you simply cannot the pain and trauma she inflicted into Jon. That said, I agree that one cannot overlook the cultural and social impact Jon Snow had on her; the life of having a baseborn bastard raised amongst her trueborn children was unheard of, and deeply shameful. The fear of Jon, or his children, or his grandchildren trying to stake a claim to Winterfell cut her as well, not helped by cultural reinforcement and history of the Blackfyre rebellions. Catelyn was right in not raising Jon as her own child, but neglecting him and refusing to treat an innocent child with basic human decency led to him growing him bitter and pained. She didn’t have a duty to raise him as her own, but she owed him the same fairness and respect that she shows to anyone else. She was verbally and emotionally abusive, and that cannot be overlooked either.

All these narratives coexist together, as George meant them to. The world is not black and white and Catelyn was a fantastic example of that. She was strong, kind, loving, protective, clever, honorable, determined, and fierce; but she was also jealous, spiteful, and callous, with her own reason no doubt, but still unjust to an innocent boy. All these narratives coexist together, as George meant them to.

Not to mention the Lady Stoneheart timeline.

I will not tag my original post anti-Catelyn, since it simply isn’t. I am a Catelyn fan as well as a Jon fan. Someone who likes the character and roots for her, but still does not ignore or romanticize her mistakes. George never wrote Catelyn as a pure and innocent Lady, and I shall not interpret her as such.

Liv, 19, Obviously a Hufflepuff

Ask Box is always open!

Is there a theme for this blog? Yeah, it’s whatever the fuck I wanna post lmao

summary: Wow. I had no idea there is a legit ship war here. Jonsa vs Jonerys? This...this is a brutal one. Y’all hate each other’s guts...
body:
Wow. I had no idea there is a legit ship war here. Jonsa vs Jonerys? This…this is a brutal one. Y’all hate each other’s guts Jesus Christ.

Here the way I see it. I understand why y’all ship one or the other. But if you’re gonna hate the other woman because you don’t ship her with Jon, then I think you’re crazy. I personally think that Sansa and Daenerys have one the best character developments in the whole show and both of them want the same things.

Peace for the hell world they live in. Take down Cersei. And I’m pretty sure they’ll both agree to take down the Night King.

But all I’ve seen shippers tearing apart the other girl. C’mon now. That’s ridiculous.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: jon x ygritte modern au with no death please!
question: jon x ygritte modern au with no death please!
answer:
So many possibilities!!…don’t ask why I picked this one XD

  • They meet on Tinder. Sansa set up Jon’s and Ygritte was literally the first person to come up. Jon thinks, what’s the worst that could happen? Ygritte could never say no to such a pretty face.
  • Their first date is actually awful. Maybe the worst date. Each leave feeling relieved that it is finally over. That night, Ygritte texts him, “lol tht sucked right?” They proceed to spend the whole night texting until it is about five in the morning and Jon realizes he has work in three hours. 
  • The next few dates actually go pretty well. Mostly, they are Ygritte bringing lunch to Jon’s work and the two of them talking until the hour is up. When one of Jon’s coworkers (Oh it is def Edd) calls Ygritte Jon’s girlfriend, neither of them correct him and that’s how they become #official. 
  • Their first kiss is very underwhelming. Neither of them were even thinking. They were just parting ways and they kiss and start to leave before they both realized that it was infact their first kiss. They turn, fistbump each other and leave grinning. 
  • Jon never asks for Ygritte to move in. She just slowly starts leaving things there behind until one morning she is in her own apartment, cannot find her hairbrush- realizes it is at Jon’s and then realizes that her apartment is basically empty and most of her things are at Jon’s. She packs up the rest of her apartment in two boxes and brings them to Jon’s. While she brushes her hair, Jon empties the two boxes and puts her things away in their apartment.

blog.description:
Hey, you can call me Mindset, or Butterfly.
I like: Comics, ASOIAF, music, art, books, sf & fantasy, butterflies, birds, pretty rocks, and many other things. See my sidebar tags and links for more details.
I help mod: ASOIAF University and A Song of Theories.
Note to ASOIAF fandom followers: I've read all the books, and rarely if ever cut for spoilers, sorry. Please check my FAQ and the other links on my sidebar for more info.

tags: the dragon must have three heads
the show is not the books
the song of ice and fire
summary:
@iheartdandelions​ reblogged 
your post “Dany’s vision of Rhaegar and Elia in the House of the Undying”

 and added:
           ...
body:
@iheartdandelions​ reblogged your post “Dany’s vision of Rhaegar and Elia in the House of the Undying” and added:

I’m not doubting Martin said this…but why? 

Because it was Rhaegar and Elia in the vision?

Why would Rhaegar have reason to say Elia’s Aegon has the “song of ice and fire”? 

Because it is a quality of the Prince that was Promised, which Rhaegar believed Elia’s son was.

“It was a prince that was promised, not a princess. Rhaegar, I thought… the smoke was from the fire that devoured Summerhall on the day of his birth, the salt from the tears shed for those who died. He shared my belief when he was young, but later he became persuaded that it was his own son who fulfilled the prophecy, for a comet had been seen above King’s Landing on the night Aegon was conceived, and Rhaegar was certain the bleeding star had to be a comet.”

–Maester Aemon, AFFC, Samwell IV

Rhaegar was corresponding with Maester Aemon on the matter of the Prince that was Promised. He was doing so about his son Aegon by Elia, who was conceived under a comet. Not about Jon, who was born a month or two after Rhaegar died, and therefore corresponding with Aemon on the matter was not possible.

It really makes no sense. Again - Martell - sun, Targaryen - dragon/fire = two things that signify warmth, fire, nothing that signifies Ice.

Rhaegar once believed that he himself was the Prince that was Promised – where’s his ice, hmm? Furthermore, Aemon goes on to say he believes Dany is the actual Prince that was Promised. Like Rhaegar, Dany is wholly Targaryen, with no Stark ancestry at all, so Aemon – a person highly educated and expert on this prophecy – also believes ice is not required for the prince’s parentage. The prince is not ice and fire, the prince’s song is the song of ice and fire.

Though it may be that Rhaegar believed a Stark would be helpful to make the third head of the dragon. It may be he believed he needed Lyanna’s ice to add to his own fire, it may be he was inspired by the historical “Pact of Ice and Fire”, the Targ/Stark betrothal that was never fulfilled. But it was to make the “one more”, because “the dragon has three heads”, and at the time shown in the vision Rhaegar believed the prince was Aegon, the son that had been born to Elia.

Couldn’t Martin have said it to…throw people off? If it was 98, it was the early days of the fandom. He couldn’t give the secret of one of his key characters away just like that.

He didn’t, GRRM doesn’t lie in his answers to people. If he thinks an answer would be a spoiler, he just refuses to answer. See this post for more. And GRRM has said such things as Targaryens are not immune to fire, that Dany birthing the dragons was a miracle unlikely to happen again, all kinds of “secret” things. But this secret is still secret– we don’t know what the song of ice and fire is, nor why it is the song of the Prince that was Promised, nor how it’s connected with the similar-but-slightly-different prophecy of Azor Ahai Reborn, nor who are the three heads of the dragon, all kinds of details that have not been revealed yet. There’s been no mention of “the song of ice and fire” since Dany’s vision in the House of the Undying, and when people ask about that, about the Prince, that’s what GRRM doesn’t answer. But confirming that Dany identified the people in the vision correctly? That he’ll do.

I know people don’t like the idea of Aegon being Jon’s real name…but seriously, if it were Aemon or something else, why would D&D change it? It’s a major detail. GRRM wouldn’t really allow them to make a change that drastic, would they?

Please see this post, but also, GRRM has no control over the tv series. They paid him quite a lot of money to get that control. He’s said he can advise them, and has, and does, and that’s what his producer’s credit’s for, but they are entirely within their rights to reject that advice.

If Aegon is Jon’s real name – which would be kinda stupid, but not impossible – it will be because Lyanna named him that because Rhaegar had convinced her of the prophecies, to be new Aegon/PTWP after the first was murdered. Not that because Rhaegar named him, or spoke about the song, since Elia’s son Aegon was alive when he died, and Jon was not born until after he died. Because Lyanna believed that her son couldn’t be the third head of the dragon, with the other two murdered, but he could be the Prince, whose song is the song of ice and fire.

Nevertheless, in that glimpse into the past that Dany saw in the House of the Undying, Rhaegar was talking to Elia about their son Aegon.

summary:
Seems some people need a reminder of this: 
“Dany is shocked and amazed. What about the Northerners? How will they 
take it? Jon...
body:
Seems some people need a reminder of this:

“Dany is shocked and amazed. What about the Northerners? How will they take it? Jon thinks they’ll understand. The ones who know him know that he never really wanted to be king anyway. And the rest of them will come to see Dany for what she is: someone from the edge of the world, just like them. Someone who could have let them all die, but didn’t.”

Straight from the script outline. No negative connotation whatsoever. Nothing ominous. No shade. Nothing to shit on Daenerys with here.

Actually, just the opposite. Enjoy.

blog.name: incorrect-got-quotes
blog.title: Dead, almost like my interest in the show
blog.description: I post quotes when I feel like it. Mostly nowadays I don’t.If you want to use one of the quotes as a story or drawing prompt, I'm fine with that, as long as you credit me in your story or art. Also, tag any drawings under #oberyn’s saucy art. Yes, I am in fact Oberyn Martell. For those on mobile, here is my ship list: https://incorrect-got-quotes.tumblr.com/list-of-ships Main: garnetislovegarnetislife. SUBMISSION BOX IS (MOST LIKELY) PERMANENTLY CLOSED!

summary:
Ygritte: When I first saw you I was like “Gods, should I do something?”
Jon: *blushes*
Ygritte: But then you got up off the...
body:
Ygritte: When I first saw you I was like “Gods, should I do something?”
Jon: *blushes*
Ygritte: But then you got up off the floor and you seemed okay.

dialogue.name: Ygritte
dialogue.label: Ygritte:
dialogue.phrase: When I first saw you I was like “Gods, should I do something?”

dialogue.name: Ygritte
dialogue.label: Ygritte:
dialogue.phrase: But then you got up off the floor and you seemed okay.
